status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
It appears that one of our users triggered a race condition in eucalyptus which allowed them to add the same user name to an account twice.  The result in the database was two users with the same creation time, different external IDs, but the same name and path.  There was also a corresponding user group for each user (same name, different IDs).  User and group adds should, of course, be atomic operations.

This problem occurred on Eucalyptus 3.0.2, and it is not known whether 3.1.0 still has this problem.  One of the side effects of this situation, though, is that it breaks upgrades.

comments.body:
This issue still occurs, reproduce as follows:

{code}
# (euare-usercreate -u user1 &) ; euare-usercreate -u user1
# euare-userlist
euare-userlistbypath      euare-userlistcerts       euare-userlistgroups      euare-userlistkeys        euare-userlistmfadevices  euare-userlistpolicies    
[root@b-28 ~]# euare-userlistbypath 
arn:aws:iam::eucalyptus:user/admin
arn:aws:iam::eucalyptus:user/user1
arn:aws:iam::eucalyptus:user/user1
{code}

From "eucalyptus_auth":

{code}
# select id, creation_timestamp, auth_user_name, auth_user_path, auth_user_id_external from auth_user;
                id                |   creation_timestamp    | auth_user_name | auth_user_path | auth_user_id_external 
----------------------------------+-------------------------+----------------+----------------+-----------------------
 8ae5819c3ae7e376013ae7e38f59000e | 2012-11-09 17:16:21.209 | admin          | /              | V4UKHMM6QBXKYGAHQZJWK
 8ae5819c3b24547d013b250918b900a3 | 2012-11-21 14:14:11.385 | user1          | /              | XI91ZZYN9GYW0SQQPFTQU
 8ae5819c3b24547d013b250918b900a4 | 2012-11-21 14:14:11.385 | user1          | /              | 49VMHXSLL8LRPWLPUSNAV
(3 rows)

# select id, creation_timestamp, auth_group_name, auth_group_path from auth_group;
                id                |   creation_timestamp    | auth_group_name | auth_group_path 
----------------------------------+-------------------------+-----------------+-----------------
 8ae5819c3ae7e376013ae7e38f59000d | 2012-11-09 17:16:21.209 | _admin          | 
 8ae5819c3b24547d013b250918b800a1 | 2012-11-21 14:14:11.384 | _user1          | 
 8ae5819c3b24547d013b250918b900a2 | 2012-11-21 14:14:11.384 | _user1          | 
(3 rows)
{code}
[~sjones], please reopen this issue if able to reproduce in latest versions of euca.

The race condition was also found for euare-groupcreate. To verify:
 (euare-usercreate -u user3 &) ; euare-usercreate -u user3
 (euare-groupcreate -g group2 &) ; euare-groupcreate -g group2

and make sure one of the call fails.
Euare is a UFS service, so uniqueness cannot be reliably enforced in the service tier (this stateful functionality should be removed), a database constraint could be used to address this issue.
[~sjones] That is a good point. Haven't thought about the implication of being UFS. I'll add constraints to entities.
Unique constraint is added to a new field.

I think this fix breaks renaming users and groups:

{code}
#
# euare-usercreate -u test-user-1
#
#
# euare-usermod -u test-user-1 -n test-user-1-renamed
#
#
# euare-usercreate -u test-user-1
euare-usercreate: error (InternalFailure): Can not create user
#
#
# euare-userdel -u test-user-1-renamed
#
#
# euare-usercreate -u test-user-1
#
#
{code}
The fix to the last bug was pushed. Let me know if you see issues. Thanks!
